author: Special Correspondent
text:
Advocates of the People’s Welfare Front (PWF) have resolved to stop the violations of election model code of conduct in Tirunelveli district and distribution of cash or gifts for votes.

A resolution to this effect was passed in their meeting held here on Saturday with Arasu Amalraj, MDMK’s State legal wing deputy secretary in chair.

The meeting said the PWF would form a 5-member advocates’ wing in each Assembly segment in the district to prevent poll code violations such as distribution of cash or gifts for votes, coercing the cadres of PWF from doing election-related work etc. The development works being carried out and road repair works taken up after the model poll code came into effect should be stopped immediately. Or else, the advocates’ team would stop it.

The official machinery should not be misused by the ruling party and the Election Commission should take action against violators in an unbiased manner. Harassment of traders and the public in the guise of checking their vehicles and belongings by the flying and the static squads should be avoided. The meeting resolved that more than 200 advocates of the alliance would participate in the PWF’s advocates’ wing conference to be held at Tiruchi on March 26.

Lawyer and former MLA R. Krishnan of Communist Party of India (Marxist) explained in detail the responsibilities of the advocates of PWF and the things to be done during electioneering for ensuring free and fair poll.

Apart from the PWF advocates, office-bearers of Marumalarchi Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam, Communist Party of India, Communist Party of India (Marxist) and Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi participated in the meeting.
title: PWF advocates resolve to stop cash or gift for votes
